artisans in the southern kosovo city of brisban have
continued the tradition of
carving jewelry and objects, using
primitive hand tools to create  create
many different products from rings,
earrings and necklaces to cigarette cases
and
Ashtrays. To create the product, the artisans first
melt gold, silver or
other precious metals. Then they press them
into wire.  Then they twist it into
thin metal strands. Finally, they use
bending techniques to create
beautiful, sophisticated jewelry. The products are so durable
that after a century they can still
be repaired and turned into products.  New
engraving techniques are available in Russia, Poland and
many other countries. However, PR has been

Sagawa city, Fukushima province participated in the
procession of giant torches, this is an
activity in the traditional fire festival
of the people.
Here Tamu Akashi Festival in Sagawa is one
of the three major fire festivals in Japan. The
festival has a history of more than 420 years starting in
1589. The highlight of the event is the
torchlight procession with about 150
participants.  Large torches along the
1.5 km long road through the city towards
Mount Goro. The fourth torches have round bodies under a
bamboo frame and are stuffed with grass, then the giant torches are
up to 7 m high and heavy.  About 1 ton of this
was brought to a park and in turn
lit a fire in the bustling Drum Rhythm.
This is considered a sacred moment
for people to pray for those who
died in the war and natural disasters
this year's festival.  Marking the return to
normal scale after 4 years of the event being
affected by the pandemic,
